document.docAuthor: Fricke, Ronald, Allen, Gerald R., Andréfouët, Serge, Chen, Wei-Jen, Hamel, Mélanie A., Laboute, Pierre, Mana, Ralph, Hui, Tan Heok & Uyeno, Daisuke
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Alionematichthys piger (Alcock, 1890 )
—Whiskered viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Møller & Schwarzhans ( 2008 : 103 )
. CAS and WAM material.

subSubSection.paragraph:
DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Andaman Islands east to Marshall , Tuamotu and Pitcairn islands , north to southern Japan , south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
0– 12 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Alionematichthys plicatosurculus
Møller & Schwarzhans, 2008
—Folded viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Møller & Schwarzhans ( 2008 : 109 )
. CAS , USNM and WAM material.

subSubSection.paragraph:
DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia to Philippines and
Papua New Guinea
,
0– 5 m
. In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs. Marine.

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Møller & Schwarzhans ( 2008 : 113 )
. CAS and USNM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Andaman Sea east to Philippines and Vanuatu , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to New Caledonia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
0– 10 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Diancistrus alleni
Schwarzhans, Møller & Nielsen, 2005
—Allen's viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. Reported from Madang in original description by
Schwarzhans et al. ( 2005
: 92
). CAS , USNM and WAM material.

subSubSection.paragraph:
DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Maldives and Chagos Archipelago east to Samoa , south to northern Australia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
5– 17 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Diancistrus altidorsalis
Schwarzhans, Møller & Nielsen, 2005
—Humpnape viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. Reported from Madang in original description by
Schwarzhans et al. ( 2005
: 95
). USNM and WAM material.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia and New Guinea east to Solomon Islands . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs. Marine.

Diancistrus beateae
Schwarzhans, Møller & Nielsen, 2005
—Beate's viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on WAM material ( WAM P. 30618 -031). DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia east to Samoa , south to northern Australia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
10– 38 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Diancistrus mcgroutheri
Schwarzhans, Møller & Nielsen, 2005
—McGrouther's viviparous brotula STATUS AT MADANG. Reported from Madang in original description by
Schwarzhans et al. ( 2005
: 129
). USNM material.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. New Guinea to northern Queensland ( Australia ). In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs. Marine.

Diancistrus novaeguineae (
Machida, 1996
)
—New Guinea viviparous brotula

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang as
Parabrosmolus novaeguineae
by
Machida ( 1996 : 148 , figs. 1–4 )
; record confirmed by
Schwarzhans et al. ( 2005
: 140–141 ). Collected by W.-J. Chen, St. PR 221 , PR 231 . BMNH , CAS , NTUM and USNM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Southwestern Pacific and southeastern Indian Ocean: Indonesia ,
Papua New Guinea
, Solomon Islands , Vanuatu and northern Australia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
5– 25 m
. Marine.

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Kailola ( 1975 : 50 )
; record confirmed by
Møller & Schwarzhans ( 2008 : 130 )
. CAS , KFRS , USNM and WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Red Sea, Seychelles and Mascarenes east to Marshall Islands and Samoa , north to Ryukyu and Ogasawara islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
0– 20 m
. Marine.

Eusurculus pristinus
Schwarzhans & Møller, 2007
—Pristine viviparous brotula

STATUS AT MADANG. Originally described from Madang by
Schwarzhans & Møller ( 2007 : 70 , figs. 25–26 )
. Specimens collected at St. CTR 0 6 , CTR 17 . MNHN , SMF and USNM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT.
Papua New Guinea
to Solomon Islands and Vanuatu . In crevices of coralline rock in coral reefs,
2– 20 m
. Marine.
